results.title: Contemplating a Canon of Jewish American Films
results.abstract: Two new films remind us that the experiences of U.S. Jews don’t often get the Hollywood treatment. When they do, depictions range from shticky to subtle.

multimedia.caption: Michael Banks Repeta and Anthony Hopkins as a boy and his grandfather in 1980s Queens in “Armageddon Time.”

results.title: ‘Avatar: The Way of Water’ Review: Big Blue Marvel
results.abstract: James Cameron returns to Pandora, and to the ecological themes and visual bedazzlements of his 2009 blockbuster.

multimedia.caption: Jake Sully (Sam Worthington), the hero of the first “Avatar,” is back in the sequel, remaking his life on the moon Pandora.

results.abstract: Alejandro G. Iñárritu narrates a sequence from his Netflix film “Bardo, False Chronicle of a Handful of Truths,” where multiple people drop to the ground in Mexico City.

results.title: ‘The Super 8 Years’ Review: Annie Ernaux’s Celluloid Memories
results.abstract: In this wistful movie, the French writer and Nobel laureate revisits her life with help from her son, who’s also the director.

results.title: When Daniel Giménez Cacho Met the Three Amigos
results.abstract: Alfonso Cuarón, Guillermo del Toro and Alejandro G. Iñárritu have each enlisted the actor in key films, including the new drama “Bardo.” They explain why.
des_facet: Bardo, False Chronicle of a Handful of Truths (Movie)

results.title: How ‘Avatar: The Way of Water’ Solved the Problem of Computer-Generated H2O
results.abstract: Nearly all of the sea shots in the blockbuster are digital. But making them seem real via performance capture led to a milestone in the technique.

multimedia.caption: Tuk (Trinity Bliss) in “Avatar: The Way of Water,” which used advances in performance capture for many of the underwater scenes.
Tuk (Trinity Bliss) in “Avatar: The Way of Water,” which used advances in performance capture for many of the underwater scenes.

results.abstract: Here are the actors, pop stars, dancers and artists who broke away from the pack this year, delighting us and making us think.

results.title: Fusion? We’ve Seen This Movie Before.
results.abstract: The promise of a new, bountiful energy source, not to mention the giant lasers, may sound familiar to fans of science fiction and comics.

results.abstract: This luminous drama, Ireland’s entry for best international feature, may not be holiday fare, but it does express the season’s benevolent ethos.

results.title: Reclaiming a Place in Animation History for a Female Pioneer

results.title: Angelo Badalamenti, Composer for ‘Twin Peaks,’ Is Dead at 85
results.abstract: The filmmaker David Lynch turned to his haunting work again and again, for “Blue Velvet,” “Mulholland Drive” and other neo-noir films.

multimedia.caption: Angelo Badalamenti in his home studio in Lincoln Park, N.J., in 2005. “Music and composing — I almost feel a little guilty about it — come so easily for me,” he said.

results.title: Judd Hirsch Can Tell You a Story or Three. ‘The Fabelmans’ Is Just the Latest.
results.abstract: The veteran actor has been singled out for his rousing performance in Steven Spielberg’s drama. It’s the latest chapter in a long career full of anecdotes.
